newsitem.title: USA: HOT STOCKS HIGHLIGHTS - U.S. corporate news.
newsitem.headline: HOT STOCKS HIGHLIGHTS - U.S. corporate news.

text.p: FORTE SOFTWARE INC down 7-3/4 to 8-7/8.
Morgan Stanley downgraded the stock to neutral from outperform. After the market closed on Thursday, Forte posted fourth quarter earnings of $0.14 a share compared with $0.05 a share a year ago.
AMERICAN POWER CONVERSION CORP down 2-1/4 to 16-3/8

On Thursday, American Power said it expects to post 1997 revenue growth of 20 to 25 percent. It said operating expenses will grow in line with revenues or up five percentage points greater than revenue growth. Also said it sees gross margins remaining in low 40 percent range.
CREDIT ACCEPTANCE CORP down 4-7/16 to 10-5/16

Credit Acceptance posted first quarter earnings of $0.26 a share compared with $0.20 a share last year. Oppenheimer & Co downgraded the stock to underperform from market perform and trimmed earnings estimates, a market source said.
ELECTRONIC DATA SYSTEMS CORP down 9-1/2 to 32-1/2

On Thursday, Electronic Data said its first quarter profits dropped 11 percent and it was taking a close look at its staffing levels. The company said it should catch up with Wall Street expectations in the second half of 1997. Several firms including Cowen & Co, Alex Brown and Merrill Lynch downgraded the stock.
USA DETERGENTS INC down 5-5/8 to 12-3/4
USA Detergents said late Thursday that it does not know whether it will be profitable for the first quarter. It said its revenues should be slightly above analysts' expectations.
DII GROUP INC up 1-1/2 to 28-3/4
DII Group posted first quarter earnings of $0.40 per fully diluted share, compared with $0.40 per fully diluted share last year.
U S WEST COMMUNICATIONS GROUP up 1 to 32-3/8
U S West posted first quarter earnings of $0.68 a share, surpassing analysts' consensus estimate of $0.65 a share. During the first quarter last year, U S West earned $0.61 a share.
XILINX INC down 2-7/8 to 48-3/8
On Thursday, Xilinx posted first quarter earnings of $0.38 a share compared with $0.43 a share last year.
WET SEAL INC up 2-1/2 to 21-5/8
Wet Seal, a young women's apparel retailer, said it expects first quarter earnings of about $0.23 a share, compared with $0.06 in the same period last year.
QUALCOMM INC rose 3-5/8 to 46-5/8.
Qualcomm said Thursday a judge in California denied Motorola Inc's motion aimed at preventing Qualcomm from selling its "Q phone."
MAXIM GROUP INC lost 2-1/4 to 8-3/4

On Thursday, Maxim said it expects its first quarter earnings to fall short of the analysts' consensus estimate by about $0.03 to $0.04 a share. The consensus earnings estimate is $0.08 a share, according to First Call. Interstate/Johnson Lane downgraded the stock to sell from buy.
BOOLE & BABBAGE INC down 2-1/2 to 21-1/4

On Thursday, Boole & Babbage posted a second quarter net loss of $0.11 a share, compared with a profit of $0.17 a share last year. Before acquisition and non-requiring costs, Boole & Babbage earned $0.31 a share, compared with $0.17 a share last year.
BELL ATLANTIC CORP up 3-5/8 to 62-3/8

On Thursday, the Justice Department approved the proposed $20 billion stock merger between Bell Atlantic and NYNEX Corp. On Friday, Merrill Lynch upgraded Bell Atlantic to a near-, and long-term buy from accumulate.
